column1: What do you think about the behavior of Crimson One?
column2: You will be presented with some statements. Please choose your level of agreement with the statements using the options given.
column3: Here is a reminder of the scenario in case you need it. Please take into account that all the questions will make reference to it:   Crimson One is an American construction business that builds residential properties in the USA. The business has around 300 employees. Crimson One has been operating for over ten years and its financial situation is very good. One day Crimson One owners decide to increase their profits and start employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. Employing cheap materials goes against the standards that almost every USA company in the same industry follow but Crimson One owners don’t mind. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and the business owners decide to stick with it. However many American homeowners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.

column1: Unethical
Morally questionable.

It is rather despicable, and I would hope that enough of their customers could get together to sue for damages.  I have to imagine that the plan to target low income purchasers was in part to avoid the likelihood of legal action...

It goes against the grain of 'Made in the USA to last' .... As an outsider, and even an employee, would find it unsettling to know about the shortcuts taken that will cost the consumer for repairs and maintenance in the end.  They may be saving money, thus better profit, but in the future their reputation may decline due to the negative feedback they will most likely receive.  I also have to think that the profit is going into the pockets of the heavy hitters in their office, but not the working people who keep the business actually going.
They clearly lack a moral compass as they are providing substandard housing to people with lower incomes.

They are a sleazy, low-down company whose business should be shut down. They are preying on  the low-income who can least afford the repairs to their home due to the shoddy material and work by this horrible company.
I think their behavior is terrible. It takes advantage of lower class people and exposes them.
They are a shady company that is cutting corners to increase profits
I think it is very shady and they should be put out of business.
detestable
Scummy
I think that Crimson One is a terrible company, and that they are borderline criminals.
I found it unethical. They are putting profits ahead of what's best for the customer.
unethical and maybe immoral. They are trying to take advantage of disadvantaged groups by determining they deserve less quality
Money hungry

Shameful. This reminds me of the recent collapse of the condominiums in Florida that were built using cheap materials. Lives were lost. Cost cutting for profit without regard to human life is immoral and capitalism at it's worst.

I think it is very selfish, irresponsible, dangerous, and shows a lack of compassion; as it is evident they realize cheap materials will cause a significant burden on the homeowner, eventually, and possibly even harm.
It is immoral and should be called out.

unethical and immoral. they are willing to jeopardize their customers safety in the name of making more money, cheap construction materials will always lead to disaster. It is degusting and grossly negligence. sooner or later their lack of quality materials and craftmanship will be revealed.
sad, immoral and unfortunately it happens a lot now
I think it's seflish, greedy and appalling. It's a success for Crimson One but what about everyone else? It will eventually hurt others and cost them money!
It's unethical and they should be punished for it.
I think its pretty slimy that they would employ cheap materials for their constructions. It costs them less and costs the homeowners a lot more in the long run; it just feels unethical.
Immoral and disgusting

It is not a best business practice, but unfortunately a lot of these low income developments are built using government programs and tax incentives, so companies are incentivized to cut corners. I would expect it is more common than is realized. So I do not condone this decision by Crimson One, but I understand it.
They only care about their business and not the livelihood of those who buy their homes.
I don't think it's ethical or proper for them to knowingly build subpar buildings.  It is dangerous and can cost people their lives.
It is despicable.  They are literally making money off the backs of poor people.
I think it was unethical and that the company will start losing business in the long run.
it is despicable to construct poor products
greedy and immoral
Seems unethical
It's reprehensible but sadly common under capitalism. Companies are out to make a profit and not to contribute to society.

I think it is unethical to use cheaper materials. They already are building these homes in low income neighborhoods so they know right away that these people will not be able to afford the repairs to their homes when these cheaper materials degrade. It is saddening and also angering that a company would do this.
I disagree with their behavior and think it is unethical. I never agree with going cheap or cutting corners when it comes to a business.
It is disgusting to hear them profiting off of bad quality construction.
It is fine if the savings are passed to the purchasers and Crimson One is not misleading about the quality.
Like many other companies, they use cheap materials to save money for the investors and owners and don't care about anything but the bottom line.

This is an example of what all of us encounter every day.   People do not matter to corporations yet they break the backs of the people who produce it.    Profit is all they look at and do not care who got it for them.

I think it is short-term thinking and not really ethical. It is not following industry standards and now consumers are paying the price with higher maintenance costs. It is likely that Crimson One's reputation will suffer and that long-term profitability will suffer.
I don't think they are a morally good company.
I think that it is immoral and a terrible practice. I think something should be done to stop them.

It's the very stereotype of reprehensible corporate behavior.  They'll enjoy increased profits short-term but hopefully the market will realize what they have done eventually and their reputation will suffer to the point that they cease to be profitable, or their victims will litigate them into bankruptcy.
It's deplorable.  It caused a lot of problems for their customers and was totally unethical.
I think it is very poor behavior that should  be punished.
It's unethical and possibly illegal.

I think that it is ethically and morally unsound to be deliberately constructing buildings that will prove to have problems and to be detrimental in the end.  I know that the temptation is to always go for what is going to make the biggest profit, but there needs to be a balance and something that is acceptable.
In the end doing poor work will be detrimental to Crimson One's reputation. It may be a short term gain, but will lead to long term negative outcomes.
I think they are disgracefull.  People thought thy were buying well constructed houses and they wound up with inferior homes which cost them money for repairs.
I think it is morally wrong and unethical
They are immoral. They're greedy. I don't think they are to be trusted. I find their behavior to be disgusting.

I think ultimately the company cares more about making money than its customers and providing safe living conditions.  It's incredibly selfish and seems like the company only cares about themselves. They are also going against industry's standards.
I think they are robbing the people who have hired them and expect a quality home.
I think its acceptable. Afterall we decided capitalism is the best economy to have, and all they are really doing is following a capitalist strategy.

It's irresponsible of Crimson One to use cheaper materials. The use of cheaper materials might lead to a profit in the near-term. But in the long run it will lead to a bad situation for the communities they're supposed to be serving.
I think it was very unethical. They caused financial harm to people who couldn't afford it simply to increase their profits when they were already profitable.

The behavior is unethical and it will likely catch up with them. If it gets out that they use cheap materials which in turn makes the homeowner pay for costly repairs, the word will get out and it will likely hurt their business prospects.
The behavior of Crimson One is unethical, as it leads to increased maintenance and repair expenses.

unethical, they should be fined heavily and sued by the homeowners. the homeowners should get enough money to rebuild their homes with industry standard materials from another home. those who make decisions should be arrested and fined individually as well.
I think it is disgusting that they would target marginalized communities, and they deserve to be punished.
It is unethical and wrong
It is greedy and unethical, but it also does not surprise me that a company is cutting corners for profits.
I believe it is a terrible business practice.  They are intentionally harming their clients.
It's shady, and if I found out I would not use them. it could taint their name and decrease profits in the long term when people found out and refuse to use them.
unethical but typical
I think the behavior of Crimson One is very immoral, they put profit before the wellbeing of American homeowners, I think they are greedy and should be held accountable for their actions.
It is very questionable.
I think it's corrupt, and their reputation will suffer.

I'd prefer that Crimson One take a more moderate approach and buy materials that have a dependable life. At the same time, I can understand how a construction company can be concerned with affordability issues.
Not good behavior and dishonest.
very sad
I don't like it.
It was despicable, because then you put people's lives at risk by building with shoddy materials.
They value profits too much.
I think Crimson One is trying to cut corners by using cheap material to build houses.
I think it is unethical and a detriment to their consumers.
bad business practace

Just IMPLORABLE AND DISGUSTING~~~  They should written up by someone and get their license taken away or pay ALL of the expenses that it will take to fix ALL of the homes that have problems later on, which probably WON'T happen because the low income can't afford a lawyer to SUE them !!!
it is unethical, and unnecessary
It is immoral.
I think their behavior is disgusting and amoral, but not surprising. Money tends to matter more than lives to many companies.

it's a double edge sword. they can provide homes inexpensively. people can have a place to live that might not afford it otherwise...if... they pass on the savings to the consumer. On the other hand, if you are going to do a job, you should do it right the first time.
They are deceiving and unethical
I feel it is very unprofessional and that they do not care for their customers.
The behavior of Crimson One was very unethical. They are cheating the less fortunate with a basic human necessity.
I think they a lousy company to take advantage of lower income people, or anyone as far as that goes.
I think it is bad morally and ethically.
I wouldn't do business with Crimson One. I think that they put profit before the best interests of their customers.
Crimson One's behavior is immoral, illegal, and they are targeting vulnerable minority populations that don't deserve it.
I consider that the behavior of Crimson One is unacceptable.  I think that the use of cheaper materials to build homes in low income areas is problematic and also displays devaluing of individuals.

I feel that the behavior of Crimson One is something that is typical amongst people who try to cheat their customers and that as a customer you need to be diligent in not working with scummy companies. I think its ultimately a negative for society as a whole for one individual/company to skim off the top like this because of how it damages the greater good of society.
It's disgusting and they should be ashamed of themselves
It is unethical and immoral. It looks for short term selfish gain and ignores long term negative consequences for those they build homes for.
It is not good.
I think it is unethical and they are cutting corners to increase profits.
Too profit oriented
It’s disgusting. I can’t help but think of the phrase it’s expensive to be poor. I hope someone seeks legal action because this is wrong and discriminatory.
It is because of behavior like this that there is so much government regulation.  Crimson One will eventually pay for this substandard behavior with a negative reputation.
Despicable, people thought they were getting well built homes and got houses that cost them more in maintenance and repair.
Very unethical.  Poor quality eventually will catch up with Crimson One.  Their reputation will be tarnished and their business will suffer because of it.

I think that ethically and morally, Crimson One is behaving badly. I understand that in certain situations, ethical and moral standards become less defined, but for a company that is well established and highly profitable, there is no way to justify their choice to use cheaper materials. The information I have been given says that other competitors or company's in the same industry do not use cheaper materials. Crimson One is sacrificing its quality, morality, humanity, and trustworthiness in order to make a larger profit.
I think their behavior is immoral and wrong.
This is unethical and possibly illegal depending on their tactics.
I thought the behavior was improper and that it should not be profiting off such bad behavior.
I think it's sad that a company would resort to this type of behavior. Of course, this happens often in real life. That's a huge part of what's wrong with the US- greed.
It is terrible.

I believe that Crimson One's behavior is unethical and shortsighted. They're allowed to reap the benefits and profits of using cheap materials and passing on the responsibility of maintenance onto low income tenants who unknowingly assumed that responsibility and do not have the resources to  maintain.
Immoral and Unethical.
I think it's pretty bad, quality of work should come before profits
It is corrupt and negligent.
It was not ethical for them to do this.  They hurt low-income people on purpose
It's unethical and they should be shut down or fined for it.

I think their behavior is corrupt and reprehensible. They only care about their profits. They don't care about the quality of their buildings in low income areas as they know they can get away with lower quality there. That hurts the people who buy these homes.
It's bad behavior, but they'll probably get away with it for a while.  Maybe they'll get hit with lawsuits, but otherwise the behavior will probably continue.
It is bad.
I think that it is irresponsible behavior and that it is something that is dangerous for others and it is something that I would not recommend doing.
I think Crimson One's behavior is unconscionable, not to mention immoral and just plain wrong, if not illegal.
Based on the scenario, it sounds a bit irresponsible, but as long as there was no deception to customers involved, it may be acceptable.
Corrupt and opportunistic
I think it is awful. Just because people are poor does not mean their homes should be built with cheap materials and it will go unnoticed.
Greedy and unethical

It is unethical for them for adapting this strategy ( for profit ) when you are putting other people in danger (may cause health problem from cheap materials residue). Other than that, homeowners will end up paying more later and will also affecting their mental health.
While it is profitable for the company, it is unethical to leave homeowners and tenants with sub par construction that will just fall apart.

Well, they are free to do it, I suppose, as long as they aren't CLAIMING that they are doing otherwise. If so, then they are lying and being dishonest. As long as they are not claiming to be still using high quality materials, then I guess it's ok. But it's not OK to trick people and try to take advantage of poorer people who may not notice. So that seems wrong. In any case, long term it will probably hurt them and isn't a good idea. It's always a better plan to do the best job that you can do and to do the right thing by other people.
